io

Class HtmlGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.runner.notification.RunListener
      • io.HtmlGenerator

  • public class HtmlGenerator
extends org.junit.runner.notification.RunListener
    HtmlGenerator extends RunListener which normally outputs data into an xml file this was useful but less readable than an html file which can be populated dynamically. This was made to be scaleable as well which can handle multiple test case classes in case more are added later. WARNING - mucking about with the html markup within this file may/will be reflected in the outputted html file. If you desire a change to this class make sure you clearly know what is being written to the html file before adding changes.
    Author:
    Chris Sullivan 2014

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testFailure(org.junit.runner.notification.Failure failure)
      if the test is finished on the independent class methods add the method name the current date it was tested and if it failed -> the stack trace from the failure
      void testFinished(org.junit.runner.Description description)
      if the test is finished on the independent class methods add the method name the current date it was tested and if it was successful -> no issues to the table
      void testRunFinished(org.junit.runner.Result result)
      if the test is finished end the last table added and print a success result message at the bottom of the html page.
      void testRunStarted(org.junit.runner.Description description)
      if the test has just started create the header for the html file as well as the beginning table for the first class
      void testStarted(org.junit.runner.Description description)
      this is different than the method above as this handles the independent classes if a key does not exist in the map create a header with classname and then start a new table
